Name: Issue 318
Introduction: G'day Everyone, It's almost September and that means it's nearly time for Spring here in Australia. I'm really looking forward to seeing the back of Winter. Have a relaxing weekend everyone and stay safe. ‚ù§ Kym

Articles.Title: UI Spacing
Articles.Description: Learn to space elements in your layout, with the help of a cheesy metaphor.
Articles.Author: Tess Gadd

Articles.Title: Shipping Mobile Apps
Articles.Description: Perspective on different release processes for mobile apps development.
Articles.Author: Wajahat Karim

Articles.Title: Scroll Reveal in Xamarin Forms
Articles.Description: Charlin shows how to implement an interesting Scroll Reveal using a ListView in Xamarin Forms. It's not a common UI requirement, but still very cool to see how it's done.
Articles.Author: Charlin Agramonte

Articles.Title: Updating an old App
Articles.Description: A brutal to-do list of steps taken to upgrade an older application to the latest framework pieces.
Articles.Author: Saamer Mansoor

Articles.Title: Mortal Kombat App using Xamarin.Forms (MAUI) Part 2
Articles.Description: Building out a pretty cool looking Mortal Kombat App using Xamarin Forms.
Articles.Author: Pavel Chuvak

Articles.Title: Introduction To Multi-Platform App UI
Articles.Description: If you are after a jump start on getting up to speed with MAUI, this is a pretty good read. Discusses MAUI Architecture, similarities and differences between Xamarin.Forms and also getting a basic app started.
Articles.Author: Sundaram Subramanian

Articles.Title: Sands of MAUI: Issue #21
Articles.Description: Sam Basu keeps us up to date with the latest news and activities in the MAUI space.
Articles.Author: Sam Basu

Articles.Title: Learn about BindableLayout
Articles.Description: If you need to just repeat a couple of elements, then BindableLayout might be the choice for you! Learn about this hidden gem in Xamarin.Forms and .NET MAUI and how to use it with ANY layout control.
Articles.Author: Gerald Versluis

Articles.Title: Compiled Bindings FTW!
Articles.Description: While using data-binding in Xamarin.Forms and .NET MAUI you might wonder: why doesn't IntelliSense work? Or can my compilation fail if a property doesn't exist? You can do this with compiled bindings! And better yet: you can get a huge performance boost while doing so!
Articles.Author: Gerald Versluis

Articles.Title: Will There Be a .NET MAUI Community Toolkit?
Articles.Description: Will there be a .NET MAUI Community Toolkit to follow up the Xamarin Community Toolkit? The answer will surprise you! Check out this Quick Questions!
Articles.Author: Gerald Versluis

Articles.Title: Which C# UI Desktop Technology to Pick?
Articles.Description: James answers the question "Which UI desktop technology should you be using if re-writing a complete desktop app with extremely specific requirements but also using Xamarin.Forms for the mobile apps."
Articles.Author: James Montemagno

Articles.Title: Merge Conflict: 268: Authentication shouldn't be hard
Articles.Description: We are joined by Tanvir Ahmed from Okta to talk about why authentication can seem so hard, but really shouldn't be. We chat about how our devices that we carry around with us every day really should be the key to unlock and remove passwords.
Articles.Author: Merge Conflict

Articles.Title: Null Pointers 67: Managing Email
Articles.Description: Managing e-mail is such a chore. Especially when you come back from vacation, and a humongous pile of it is looking straight at you. Is a Tinder-style application THE solution here? Find out in this episode!
Articles.Author: Null Pointers

Articles.Title: Starting a List of Xamarin / MAUI apps
Articles.Description: Malcom Jack is putting together a list of apps build with Xamarin / MUAI. If you've got a app out in the store you might want to add it to the list
Articles.Author: Malcolm Jack
